newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Swiss bond market closing report.
newsitem.headline: Swiss bond market closing report.

text.p: Swiss bonds ended up sharply as March Confederate bond futures set new highs.
German and U.S. bonds also climbed steeply after U.S. data resassured markets about inflation.
U.S. fourth quarter gross domestic product showed a stronger than expected 4.7 percent rise but the deflator was 1.4 percent versus 1.8 percent forecast.

"We moved in tandem with the Bunds and Treasuries," one Swiss dealer said, adding that it appeared market markers were unwilling to short Swiss bonds at current levels. Customer sentiment was also seen as bullish.
Demand in the cash market favoured maturities from 2006 to 2008.
The March futures contract hit a high for the day of 118.00, taking out its most recent high of 117.89 set on January 23.

Shorter maturities were also firmer, with the Swiss National Bank adding liquidity to the money market this morning in what traders judged to be a relatively generous operation designed to keep call money in its current rate below 2.00 percent, and above 1.50 percent.
March Comi medium-term bond down two at 111.18
Mar Euro Swiss francs up three at 98.26.
